de.unkrig.notemplate.util

Class Entities

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unkrig.notemplate.util.Entities

  • public final class Entities
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility functionality which deals with XML and HTML "entities".
    See Also:
    HTML and XML character entities

    • Method Summary

      Replaces all characters with unicode code point 128 and greater either with An "HTML character entity reference" (like "&auml;" for "ä"), if defined for the codepoint, or A "numeric character reference" (like "&#12345;" for the character for codepoint 12345).

    • Method Detail

      • replaceXmlSpecialCharactersWithPredefinedEntities

        public static java.lang.String replaceXmlSpecialCharactersWithPredefinedEntities(java.lang.String s)
        Replaces the five XML "special characters" with the respective "predefined entities".
        Predefined entities in XML
        NameCharacterUnicode code point (decimal)Description
        quot"U+0022 (34)double quotation mark
        amp&U+0026 (38)ampersand
        apos'U+0027 (39)apostrophe (apostrophe-quote)
        lt<U+003C (60)less-than sign
        gt>U+003E (62)greater-than sign

      • replaceNonAsciiCharactersWithHtmlCharacterReferences

        public static java.lang.String replaceNonAsciiCharactersWithHtmlCharacterReferences(java.lang.String s)
        Replaces all characters with unicode code point 128 and greater either with
        • An "HTML character entity reference" (like "&auml;" for "ä"), if defined for the codepoint, or
        • A "numeric character reference" (like "&#12345;" for the character for codepoint 12345).

        Particularly, double quotes, ampersands, single quotes, less-than signs and greater-than signs (also known as "XML special characters") are not replaced!

        See Also:
        replaceXmlSpecialCharactersWithPredefinedEntities(String)

      • replaceNonAsciiCharactersWithNumericCharacterReferences

        public static java.lang.String replaceNonAsciiCharactersWithNumericCharacterReferences(java.lang.String s)
        Replaces all characters with unicode code point 128 and greater with "numeric character references" (like "&#12345;" for the character for codepoint 12345).
        See Also:
        replaceXmlSpecialCharactersWithPredefinedEntities(String)
